property.name: text
property.value:
MultiInstanceComposite Chat
This model uses a MultiInstanceComposite actor to implement the chat service.
It almost works - but - the POSTS are sent randomly to one of the outputs (since there are two queues? Need to copy message? Or have single queue?)

property.name: text
property.value: SingleEvent needed as input to ThreadedComposite to tell inside DE director to fire. Without this, the inside DE director does not fire, therefore events enqueued by HttpActor are ignored.

property.name: text
property.value: I.e. without SingleEvent, don't see: ========= DE Director director fires at 0.0 with microstep as 0 Queue is empty. Waiting for input events.

property.name: text
property.value: For each ThreadedComposite, set timeDelay to UNDEFINED synchronizeToRealTime to false

property.name: text
property.value: Clients use PN director Any benefit to using ThreadedComposite here? (Probably not?)

entity.name: ChatClient1
entity.doc: Execute the contained model in a separate thread with optional real-time properties.

svg.text: Make sure there is a director here!

property.name: text
property.value:
This model requires that ChatServer be running providing a chat service at the specified URL. Such a chat server is available at
$PTII/org/ptolemy/ptango/demo/Chat/ChatServer.xml
which you can access by clicking on this comment.

entity.name: InteractiveShell
entity.doc: Produce strings from an interactive shell on the screen

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

property.name: text
property.value: The server responds with empty strings to keep the connection alive and responsive. Filter these, as we don't want to display them to the user. Also, trim white space around the response.

entity.name: StringFunction
entity.doc: Trim a string, convert a string to uppercase, or convert a string to lowercase depending on the user's selection.

entity.name: StringCompare
entity.doc: Output a comparison function of two strings

entity.name: ChatServer
entity.doc: Execute the contained model in a separate thread with optional real-time properties.

svg.text: Make sure there is a director here!

property.name: text
property.value:
This model launches a web server and provides a simple chat service with a RESTful interface at URL http://localhost:8078/chat.
Two chat clients are included in the top-level model.

property.name: text
property.value: This model uses "long polling" so that an HTTP GET receives as a response text provided by the next HTTP POST. Each client has its own URL for GET requests, with the client ID as a suffix. This model supports only two clients. More clients can be supported by adding more instances of HttpActor.

property.name: text
property.value: If a GET request is pending in the queue, then send the formatted post as a reply.

property.name: text
property.value: In order to keep the connection alive and responsive, this model will send the defaultResponse if maximumResponseTime (in seconds) has elapsed since the last HTTP Get request. If a post arrives in that time interval, then it will send the contents of the post instead.

property.name: text
property.value: Only one response should be supplied at a time. Nevertheless, MultiInstanceComposite requires outputs to be connected to multiports, so a Merge actor is inserted.

svg.text: Make sure there is a director here!

property.name: text
property.value: This model queues a get request (at most one) and when a post arrives, if there is a pending get request, then it responds with the contents of the post.

svg.text: Only respond if I am the instance assigned to this name

property.name: text
property.value: Each post that arrives is sent to the output as a response. In addition, if no post arrives with maximumResponseTime of a trigger input, then send a default response with value defaultResponse (which is by default an empty string).

entity.name: StringConst
entity.doc: Create a constant sequence with a string value.

entity.name: StringCompare
entity.doc: Output a comparison function of two strings
